result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph W Cloud in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Joseph W Cloud in custody. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:58 p.m.   Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose 90 day jail sentence - concurrent to any sentence currently being served
Jail credit of 22 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days from date of release or you will need to set up a payment plan upon release from prison (release date is 12/05/17)
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus  Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 04/19/17

Defendant Joseph W Cloud in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Joseph W Cloud in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:48 p.m. case is called and appearances stated and the record.
Defendant's waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.   It does mirror the criminal complaint.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Based on the written waiver, defendants responses, Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily intelligently and understandingly waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, binds the defendant over for trial. 
Based on the facts alleged in complaint, court finds probable cause exists.

Bond Continued

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered to both counts.

Defendant Joseph W Cloud appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant didn't receive complaint but says he knows his charges and wants to request a 90 day speedy trial.   Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint

ADA Constable  states facts for anticipated charges of Resist/obstruct and Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
